intro: Artemisia laciniata f. mertensiana, commonly known as the Mertens' wormwood, is a perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage composed of finely divided, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in panicles, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine and steppe habitats. Due to its medicinal properties and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and herbal gardens.
